byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

abstract: Greece announces agreement with its international creditors that will make available as much as 12 billion euros, or around $13 billion, in loans; Greek Parliament must vote on deal, and measure is expected to pass.
lead_paragraph: The breakthrough was an agreement to protect the most vulnerable indebted homeowners from foreclosure, while buffering banks from the worst bad loans.

headline.main: Greece and Eurozone Creditors in Deal to Unlock $13 Billion
headline.print_headline: Greece and Creditors in Deal to Unlock $13 Billion Loan

snippet: The breakthrough was an agreement to protect the most vulnerable indebted homeowners from foreclosure, while buffering banks from the worst bad loans.
